tool.name: truncate reverse primer
tool.description: Takes a demultiplexed fasta file, finds a specified reverse primer sequence, and truncates this primer and subsequent sequences following the reverse primer.
tool.command:
truncate_reverse_primer.py -f $fasta_fp -m $mapping_fp -o truncate_reverse_primer_output #if str($truncate_option) != 'None': -z $truncate_option #end if
#if $primer_mismatches: -M $primer_mismatches #end if ; compress_path.py -i truncate_reverse_primer_output -o $output_dir

param.label: -f/--fasta_fp: Fasta file. Needs to have fasta labels in proper demultiplexed format.
param.name: fasta_fp

param.label: -m/--mapping_fp: Mapping filepath. ReversePrimer field required. Reverse primers need to be in 5'->3' orientation.
param.name: mapping_fp

param.label: -z/--truncate_option: Truncation option. The default option, "truncate_only" will try to find the reverse primer to truncate, and if not found, will write the sequence unchanged. If set to "truncate_remove", sequences where the reverse primer is not found will not be written. [default: truncate_only]
param.name: truncate_option

param.label: -M/--primer_mismatches: Number of mismatches allowed in the reverse primer. [default: 2]
param.name: primer_mismatches

tool.help: Takes input mapping file and fasta sequences which have already have been demultiplexed (via split_libraries.py, denoise_wrapper.py, ampliconnoise.py, etc.) with fasta labels that are in QIIME format, i.e., SampleID_#. This script will use the SampleID and a mapping file with a ReversePrimer column to find the reverse primer by local alignment and remove this and any subsequent sequence in a filtered output fasta file. Truncated version of the input fasta file (based on input name with 'seqs_rev_primer_truncated' appended) will be generated in the output directory, along with a .log file.
